decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Broodscale Bloodchief and various cards such as Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Devourer of Destiny to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to ramp up mana production and control the board, while cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble provide additional support and removal options. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to efficiently build up a powerful board presence and execute a devastating combo to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and efficient spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By playing aggressive threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support to protect and enhance the creatures on the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support the diverse range of colors needed to cast the spells in the deck efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide aggressive threats, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah offers additional creature recursion. Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide reach and removal, while cards like Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Arena of Glory can also provide a late-game advantage by giving your creatures additional power.

The deck focuses on utilizing Song of Creation and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create card advantage and generate infinite loops, ultimately leading to a win condition with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Malevolent Rumble. It also includes Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber for additional value and mana acceleration. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Repeal and Engineered Explosives, while also utilizing cards like Candy Trail and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for additional utility. Urza's Saga provides synergy with artifacts, and Boomerang Basics is included for disruption and tempo play.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing a mix of color mana sources to cast powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the board. The Leyline cards provide additional protection and support for the creatures, while cards like Consign to Memory offer flexibility in dealing with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for quick and efficient plays to overwhelm opponents in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures along with disruptive spells to control the game. Ragavan and Phlage are used as threats to pressure the opponent, while Quantum Riddler provides card advantage. Solitude and Prismatic Ending offer removal options, while Consign to Memory can disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also has a small amount of interaction with counterspells like Spell Snare. The mana base is built to support the different colored spells and includes lands that provide additional utility. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to take advantage of the Hollow One mechanic and bring out big threats like Detective's Phoenix and Marauding Mako. The deck also includes cards like Nethergoyf and Lightning Bolt for removal and disruption, while utilizing the aggression of Orcish Bowmasters and Inti, Seneschal of the Sun to maintain pressure on the opponent. The use of cards like Arena of Glory and Thoughtseize helps to control the opponent's resources and ensure the deck can come out on top in a fast-paced, aggressive matchup.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combo strategy without relying on traditional lands. By using cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect, the deck can generate mana without needing land cards. The key win condition is Goblin Charbelcher, which can deal massive damage to the opponent when activated. The deck also includes plenty of counter spells and disruption cards to protect the combo and control the game. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to cast a high number of spells in a single turn. By using Ral, Monsoon Mage's +1 ability to copy spells and generate additional mana, the deck aims to cast Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and finish off the opponent with a large Grapeshot or overwhelming board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Strike It Rich to dig for key combo pieces and maintain card advantage.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer for additional damage and disruption. The deck aims to establish early board presence and pressure the opponent with a mix of creatures and direct damage spells. Support cards like Guide of Souls and Arena of Glory help protect the creatures and maintain control of the battlefield, while cards like Voice of Victory provide additional utility and resilience.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply early pressure, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional creature support and removal. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature aggression and burn spells.

This deck utilizes the Allosaurus Combo to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. By utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform, the deck can quickly search for and play these creatures. Additionally, cards like Veil of Summer and Pact of Negation help protect the combo from disruption, while Planar Genesis allows for a massive board presence. Overall, the deck focuses on an explosive combo strategy to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana using rituals and mana-generating spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, then draw and play multiple cards in a single turn using cards like Reckless Impulse and Strike It Rich. The deck can also retrace spells from the graveyard with Past in Flames and generate mana with cards like Ruby Medallion. The combo finish comes from generating a large amount of mana and then casting either Grapeshot or Ral, Monsoon Mage to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some land utility with cards like Sunbaked Canyon and Valakut Awakening.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Force of Negation, Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push, while also generating card advantage and locking down the opponent's resources with cards like Quantum Riddler, Psychic Frog, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes versatile threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's hand, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and gain a significant advantage over time. With a strong suite of control spells and disruptive threats, the deck can outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition. This Dimir Control deck excels at managing the game state and adapting to different situations by using a combination of countermagic, removal, and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively pressure the opponent using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with cheap spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to maintain tempo and card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration, while also having some protection with Violent Urge and Unholy Heat. The mana base is optimized for efficiency, allowing for consistent aggression and disruption.
